meanings.definition: To put someone or something at risk or in danger.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the gate open is endangering the safety of the animals.
meanings.sent2: Speeding on the road is endangering other drivers.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to lock the door is like endangering our home to surprise visitors.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs is endangering our well-being like walking on thin ice.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire is endangering oneself to getting burned.

meanings.definition: To expose someone or something to harm or peril.
meanings.sent1: Leaving toxic chemicals out is endangering the environment.
meanings.sent2: Leaving a child unattended is endangering their safety.
meanings.sent3: Not wearing a helmet while biking is like endangering your head to bumps.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring safety protocols is endangering the project like sailing into a storm.
meanings.sent5: Swimming in rough waters is endangering oneself to drowning.
